titleStmt.title: Walters Ms. W.671, Album of Persian miniatures and calligraphy
Muraqqaʿ
مرقع

availability.p: Licensed for use under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported Access Rights, http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/legalcode. It is requested that copies of any published articles based on the information in this data set be sent to the curator of manuscripts, The Walters Art Museum, 600 North Charles Street, Baltimore MD 21201.

notesStmt.note: This album of painting and calligraphy was compiled in the late thirteenth century AH / nineteenth CE or early fourteenth century AH / twentieth CE, most likely in Turkey. The signed pieces of calligraphy represent nine different Persian calligraphers, including Sulṭān ʿAlī al-Mashhadī, Sulṭān Murād al-Ḥusaynī, Muḥammad Ḥusayn, Niʿmat Allāh al-Mashhadī, Muḥammad Aṣghar, Shāh Muḥammad al-Mashhadī, and Muḥammad Zamān. There are thirty-one paintings, the majority of which are executed in the Safavid style but are attributable to the late thirteenth century AH / nineteenth CE or early fourteenth century AH / twentieth CE. They were most likely made in Turkey. The borders are polychrome and marbled gold-sprinkled paper. The brown leather binding decorated with landscape scenes and brushed with gold is contemporary with the compiling of the album.

msContents.textLang: The primary language in this manuscript is Persian. The secondary language of this manuscript is Arabic.

handDesc.handNote: Written in nastaʿlīq script by Muḥammad Ḥusayn (fol. 2a), Sulṭān Murād al-Ḥusaynī (fol. 6a), Sulṭān ʿAlī al-Mashhadī (fol. 10b), Niʿmat Allāh al-Mashhadī (fol. 12a), Muḥammad Aṣghar (fols. 18b and 19b), Muḥammad Zamān (fol. 20b), Mīr ʿAlī (fol. 22a), ʿAlī (fol. 14b), and Shāh Muḥammad al-Mashhadī (fol. 32b)

decoDesc.decoNote: Thirty-one illustrations; borders of polychrome and marbled gold-sprinkled paper

decoNote.title: Bahrām Gūr rests on the lap of a princess in a cave
Calligraphy page
decoNote.note: This calligraphy page is written in nastaʿlīq script and signed by Muḥammad Ḥusayn, whose name appears in the fourth register from the top.

decoNote.title: Serving wine by a stream of water
Calligraphy page
decoNote.note: This calligraphy page is written in nastaʿlīq script.

decoNote.title: Seated young woman with a tray of pomegranates
Calligraphy page
decoNote.note: This calligraphy page is written in nastaʿlīq script.

decoNote.title: Seated woman with a tray of pomegranates
Calligraphy page
decoNote.note: This calligraphy page is written in nastaʿlīq script by Sulṭān Murād al-Ḥusaynī.

decoNote.title: Calligraphy page
decoNote.note: This calligraphy page is written in nastaʿlīq script.

decoNote.title: Calligraphy page
decoNote.note: This calligraphy page is written in nastaʿlīq script.

decoNote.title: Seated youth with a wine pitcher and a cup in his hand
Calligraphy page
decoNote.note: This calligraphy page is written in nastaʿlīq script and signed by Sulṭān ʿAlī al-Mashhadī, dated 989 AH / 1581 CE.

decoNote.title: Falconer kneeling in front of a seated prince
Calligraphy page
decoNote.note: This calligraphy page is written in nastaʿlīq script by Nuʿmat Allāh al-Mashhadī.

decoNote.title: Youth with a bow and arrow
Calligraphy page
decoNote.note: This calligraphy page is written in nastaʿlīq script and is from a manuscript of Khusraw va Shīrīn.

decoNote.title: Young woman reclining against a pillow
Calligraphy page
decoNote.note: This calligraphy page is written in nastaʿlīq script by Muḥammad Aṣghar.

decoNote.title: Seated woman with pomegranates and a pitcher
Calligraphy page
decoNote.note: This calligraphy page is written in nastaʿlīq script and is signed by Muḥammad Zamān.

decoNote.title: The sculptor Farhād
decoNote.note: This is a drawing illustrating the story of Farhād, the sculptor, originally from Khusraw va Shīrīn.

decoNote.title: Calligraphy page
decoNote.note: This calligraphy page is written in nastaʿlīq script and signed by Mīr ʿAlī.

decoNote.title: Standing youth with a pitcher and cup
Standing youth with a wine flask in his hand
Standing youth
decoNote.note: This painting is inscribed Aghā Riz̤ā.

decoNote.title: Seated young woman holding a book
Seated youth with a wine flask in his hand
Standing youth with his hands crossed
Youth with a wine flask reclining against a pillow
Youth with a turban reclining against a cushion
Shīrīn meets Farhād
decoNote.note: This is a drawing illustrating the story of Farhād, the sculptor, originally from Khusraw va Shīrīn.

decoNote.title: Calligraphy page
decoNote.note: This calligraphy page is written in nastaʿlīq script and is signed by Shāh Muḥammad al-Mashhadī.

decoNote.title: Man playing a stringed instrument in a landscape

binding.p: Contemporary with the compiling of the album; brown leather (with flap); decorated with a landscape scene brushed with gold; doublures of red leather, richly decorated with floral motifs

origin.origDate: 10th century AH / 16th CE -- 14th century AH / 20th CE

history.acquisition: Walters Art Museum, 1931, by Henry Walters bequest
